content:
3.102. 
Conclusion of the marriage contract 
1. A marriage contract may be concluded before the registration of the marriage (prenuptial agreement) or at any time after the registration of the marriage (postnuptial agreement). 
2. A marriage contract concluded before the registration of the marriage shall enter into force on the date of registration of the marriage. A marriage contract shall enter into force as from the date of its conclusion, unless the contract provides otherwise. 
3. A minor may conclude a marriage contract only after the registration of the marriage. 
4. A spouse who has been recognised by a court decision as having limited legal capacity in this area may conclude a marriage contract only with the written consent of his/her guardian. If the guardian does not give his/her consent, the court may authorise the conclusion of the marriage contract at the request of the spouse.
